grade: Jōyō kanji, taught in junior high
on reading compounds: 胴【ドウ】trunk, torso, body, abdomen, waist, plastron (in kendo), touching the plastron (kimari-te in kendo), frame (of a drum, etc.), sound box (of a shamisen, etc.), hull (of a ship)
胴上げ【ドウアゲ】lifting a person high (in celebration), tossing someone into the air, carrying someone on shoulders
共鳴胴【キョウメイドウ】sound box (of an instrument), sounding box
寸胴【ズンドウ】cylindrical container (pot, vase, etc.), having no waist (straight body figure, not curvy), being stumpy, sleeveless (coat etc.)
